{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3676514,"name":"FredK","username":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-08T13:07:15.678Z","cooked":"

Looking for a source of JST 6 pin female connectors with wires attached, to replace broken ones on several Neos. We were planning to solder them on, but are interested in other solutions. We have difficulty crimping them.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-08T13:08:08.116Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":68,"reads":165,"readers_count":164,"score":373.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504043,"topic_slug":"jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source","display_username":"FredK","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source/504043/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3676518,"name":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","username":"Greg_Needel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greg_needel/{size}/244586_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-08T13:22:55.253Z","cooked":"

for the ones on my team we use these and solder them on, heat shrink around the board and then just use regular cables between them.

REV Robotics

JST PH 6-pin Breakout Board - 4 Pack

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 7.5

There is an option that allows you to press in the wires without crimping but I have had mixed results with these. 06KR-6H-P JST Sales America Inc. | Connectors, Interconnects | DigiKey

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-08T13:22:55.253Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":162,"readers_count":161,"score":102.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504043,"topic_slug":"jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source","display_username":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","primary_group_name":"REV","flair_name":"REV","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/d/b/db93216ec14c273ae2ca04aa396186c0461d0620.png","flair_bg_color":"F05A28","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":55,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1276/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"JST PH 6-pin Breakout Board - 4 Pack - REV Robotics","clicks":29},{"url":"https://www.digikey.com/en/products/detail/jst-sales-america-inc/06KR-6H-P/2797480","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"06KR-6H-P JST Sales America Inc. | Connectors, Interconnects | DigiKey","clicks":11}],"read":true,"user_title":"REV Robotics","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":511,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source/504043/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3676519,"name":"Jeremiah Johnson","username":"Johnsonjer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/9d8465/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-08T13:23:03.624Z","cooked":"

One option is to buy extension cables and cut them in the middle.

Otherwise, Digikey sells pre-crimped leads found here, then you just need to press them into a 6-pin connector housing.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-08T13:24:04.261Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":80.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504043,"topic_slug":"jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source","display_username":"Jeremiah Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.digikey.com/en/products/filter/jumper-wires-pre-crimped-leads/453?s=N4IgTCBcDaIFYGcAuACADgCxAXQL5A","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61884,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6419M, 648A"},"post_url":"/t/jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source/504043/3","custom_user_title":"6419M, 648A","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3676523,"name":"FredK","username":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-08T13:37:39.187Z","cooked":"

Does the precrimped one require a new connector, or can you reuse the one that comes on the Neos?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-08T13:40:20.418Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":32.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504043,"topic_slug":"jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source","display_username":"FredK","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":61884,"username":"Johnsonjer","name":"Jeremiah Johnson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/9d8465/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source/504043/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3676566,"name":"Jeremiah Johnson","username":"Johnsonjer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/9d8465/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-08T14:41:55.200Z","cooked":"

If you are careful and/or have the correct tool you can remove the pins from the connector you already have. There is a small prong that needs to be depressed with a tiny flat head screwdriver or needle and then the pin can be pushed out. I would recommend having a set of these pin removal tools on-hand.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-08T14:41:55.200Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":57.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504043,"topic_slug":"jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source","display_username":"Jeremiah Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/JRready-Extractor-Removal-Connectors-Connector/dp/B0B6FMZMH4?th=1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":31768,"username":"FredK","name":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61884,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6419M, 648A"},"post_url":"/t/jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source/504043/5","custom_user_title":"6419M, 648A","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3676569,"name":"Ian Osborn","username":"Sands","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/22d042/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-08T15:04:49.453Z","cooked":"

I would suggest having a kit on hand:

amazon.com

Amazon.com: Taiss 580PCS JST PH Connector kit 2.0mm 2/3/4/5/6Pin Housing,Female...

Amazon.com: Taiss 580PCS JST PH Connector kit 2.0mm 2/3/4/5/6Pin Housing,Female and Male Adapter Cable Connector Plug,PH2.0mm Female Pin Connectors,JST Connector F-066-580PCS : Electronics

$9.99

Also crimpers and small stripper.

Base information:

https://www.mattmillman.com/info/crimpconnectors/common-jst-connector-types/

If you haven’t done these, then a desktop magnifier as well as some practice. It’ll take 3-4 tries to get them correct.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-08T15:04:49.453Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":51.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504043,"topic_slug":"jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source","display_username":"Ian Osborn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/Taiss-Connector-Housing-Connectors-F-066-580PCS/dp/B0BHT1FQGY","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":9},{"url":"https://www.mattmillman.com/info/crimpconnectors/common-jst-connector-types/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52040,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source/504043/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3676582,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-08T15:20:21.729Z","cooked":"

This is also a good trick:
https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08T89ZK2Q?th=1
You can assemble extension cords with this and/or cut the ends off and solder. Keep in mind that crimping JST PH pins is OMG fiddly, and that’s coming from someone with decades of experience with crimping stuff. A step worse than Dupont/Molex.

I’d suggest soldering and heat shrinking these on vs choosing to crimp on.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-08T15:20:21.729Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":96,"readers_count":95,"score":114.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504043,"topic_slug":"jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08T89ZK2Q?th=1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source/504043/7","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681170,"name":"FredK","username":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-14T16:59:16.917Z","cooked":"

I’m having trouble determining which extractor works with the JST PH 2.0. Can you tell me? Thanks.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-14T16:59:16.917Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":46,"readers_count":45,"score":14.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504043,"topic_slug":"jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source","display_username":"FredK","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":61884,"username":"Johnsonjer","name":"Jeremiah Johnson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/9d8465/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source/504043/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681224,"name":"Jeremiah Johnson","username":"Johnsonjer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/9d8465/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-14T18:11:16.534Z","cooked":"

The extractor from JReady for these is DRK-T210250. Pin size for JST-PH is 1.5mm (approx. .062").

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-14T18:11:16.534Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":37,"readers_count":36,"score":7.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504043,"topic_slug":"jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source","display_username":"Jeremiah Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":31768,"username":"FredK","name":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61884,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6419M, 648A"},"post_url":"/t/jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source/504043/9","custom_user_title":"6419M, 648A","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681229,"name":"Ryan Reed","username":"Ryan_Reed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_reed/{size}/268514_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-14T18:21:36.884Z","cooked":"

image1200×1200 41.7 KB

You need to press the small metal tab down below the plastic catch. It can help to push the wire further into the connector, if the metal tab is being pushed against the plastic catch it can be harder to lower the tab below the catch. Once the tab has been lowered then you can pull it out the back.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-14T18:21:36.884Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":33,"readers_count":32,"score":16.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504043,"topic_slug":"jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source","display_username":"Ryan Reed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66264,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/jst-6-pin-connector-replacements-source/504043/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3681237,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-14T18:36:37.714Z","cooked":"
Ryan_Reed:

You need to press the small metal tab down below the plastic catch.

I’ve had outstanding success with just the tip of an X-Acto style knife - you can also use the sharp blade of the knife to raise the tab back up if needed - they are fairly short and not as springy as you’d hope and sometimes they need a little help to get back up into position.

As an alternative, you can slightly pry up on the plastic catch as well - they’ll get back into their original position with a little downward press if needed.

A lot of this is finesse. How much do you need to press or pry? Just enough to get the job done.

After a few times, new folks will get the touch.
